basic_info.description: ðŸ‘‹ Welcome to my portfolio! My name is Tricia Sawyer and I am currently a student at DeltaV code school, studying software development, which I will graduate in July of 2023. Before that, I was a college student at Kirkwood Community College where I received my associates of Liberal Arts. Software development is something I chose to do right after I graduated, as I took some classes in tech and grew an interest. Along the way, I have gained experience using programming languages such as React, Javascript, CSS, and HTML and with that, I plan to pursue a career in web development or mobile app creation. Through my educational experiences, I have refined my skills in problem solving, collaboration, and time management. Thank you!

projects.title: Claws and Paws Adoption
projects.description: This was my first group project. Our problem domain was to create an adoption website for users to specifiy what they're looking for in a pet, in order to find their perfect match efficiently.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: I was given a Problem Domain about a friend, Pat, who wants to start a business called Salmon Cookies, with mutliple locations. He wanted help creating internal data management around customers and cookie sales. This project was worked on throughout multiple lab projects and uses the programming languages HTML, CSS, and Javascript. This was my first project that implemented Javascript!

projects.title: Odd Duck
projects.description: This was a multi-lab project that showcases a companies products. I created a webpage that allows the public to vote on what products they are interested in, giving the company the ability to visual view those products and their popularity with a results output that also displays a bar chart.
